Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: The woman at reception was lovely most the time, very helpful. The food was good, quite standard but still nice. The beach was close, and there was a great restaurant/ cocktail bar about 100 yards south down the road called 'Caribe'. Definitely recommend that bar. Rooms were nice, a bit small but still nice. We got a view of the tennis courts which was cool watching people play tennis in the morning;) Beach is nice, but there are private parts of the beach so you may want to ask whats private and whats not. Generally, good stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Venice for the film festival and you are on a budget, do pick this hotel. Do not choose on any other”
Reviews.Author: MarieGiaNelli
Reviews.Content: It is right next to Excelsior, the celebrity hotel, and real close to the cinema and basically the center of all things Venice Film Festival. The price was great, the consierge was helpful. The room was very spacious and clean. But there was no elevetor which was a huge setback when you are on a time schedule! Plus, it may be close to festival central but is is far way from the city center... To top it off, many rooms(including mine) have a view of the local tennis club, so expect to be kept awake by the sound of bouncing balls.....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pollie_7
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe all the other satisfactory reviews but our first moments upon entering the hotel were met by a miserable guy on the door who did not so much crack his face let alone smile and that's how he stayed throughout our 7 day stay - both me & my husband are naturally cheerful people so he wasn't meeting like for like. It got worse, the room was extremely dated with depressing old fashioned brown furniture dominating the room and a very cheap dated bathroom containing a tiny plastic shower. Staff burst into our room whilst we were in on several occasions without knocking, not to clean as sometimes in the late afternoon! The bathroom was not cleaned properly just a wipe round and on day 5 I noticed an old stain on the bedding but didn't dare complain not knowing what the consequences would be! The television did not work and when I queried this at reception the guy was reluctant to give any explaination other than none of the tv's worked. Pet's were allowed-I did not know this & don't like dogs so would never have considered here if I'd known! The lights around the hotel did not work and I was literally feeling my way up the stairs in the dark. Again the whole hotel had a dark, dreary and old fashioned look about it, looking more like something out of a comedy sketch expecting Basil Fawlty to jump out at any moment. We very nearly checked out but could not afford the added cost of another week's accommodation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great family-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: flavouz
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a really inexpensive hotel to stay while visiting Venice, this is a good option. Even though it's located in Lido, not Venice's main island, it's just 10 minutes away by "vaporetto" (the round trip was around 10 euros, including the bus fare from the hotel to the vaporetto pier, if one doesn't want to walk). The room was quite big, very clean; there's a beach just in front of the hotel. And I was surprised to know there was even a breakfast included in my fare. One thing I liked about staying in Lido was that it's really different from Venice. Less touristic, less crowded. And from there, you can enjoy the sun setting behind Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel with biggest bathroom for European standards”
Reviews.Author: ru89
Reviews.Content: Cons: - funny smelling rooms -we wanted to go for a walk in the morning,Lobby door was locked at 630 AM and no one is available to open the door until 730 -internet connection is slow and needed help finding keys and is frustrating to call for help -no lift, steep/ small steps, our room was on 3rd floor Pros: -Big bath room with excellent shower -view of Tennis court -break fast was okay

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sparkyd2002
Reviews.Content: My wife and our 2 children (3 and 5) stayed here for 2 nights after a recent east med cruise. This is a typical 2 star european hotel in terms of its decor and facilities however where it excels in my opinion is the nice modern bathroom and good shower + the very helpful and friendly staff. We all stayed in a family room, large double bed and bunk beds for the children and the room was clean and air conditioned. the staff gave us plenty of information about the public beaches, good restaurants and the transport options. Also got advised to use the local stop to get the Alilaguna direct to the airport. We had arrived on main LIDO stop and didnt even know we had thi soption so we only had to walk 5 minutes with our luggage! Good tip. They had the timetables of all the buses and vaporettas which was useful.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff , and hotel was very clean.”
Reviews.Author: mickthenorth
Reviews.Content: This is a family run 2 star budget hotel which was very friendly, the staff couldn't do enough for us. I shared a twin room and the room was very clean with a modern bathroom. Breakfast is a buffet style and offers a wide choice of different delicious foods. We booked this hotel a couple of months before we went and we got it a bargain. If I was coming back to the iland of Lido I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, not for young kids”
Reviews.Author: USABunch
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed here last year. A few suggestions for the large families. They don't have interconnecting rooms, so, you can choose to stay in a large room with bunk beds or separate into different rooms. The rooms were clean, but a bit small, even for European standards. The breakfast was good and had a variety of cereals which the kids enjoyed. There is no elevator, so keep that in mind if you have smaller children like us that tend to fall asleep in the stroller. The rate was pretty good compared to some of the other hotels in the area, so if you're looking for an average hotel for a good value, give the place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful family run hotel on Venice Lido!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_S74
Reviews.Content: We have recently come back from staying at the Hotel Rivamare and we wanted to say thank you for making our stay in Venice a wonderful one! Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and helpful and it is fantastic value for the location. A hidden gem and only a few yards from the beach! The hotel is very pretty and in a perfect location. Compliments must also go to the breakfast buffet which was delicious, the best we have ever had on holiday. We will definitely be recommending Hotel Rivamare to our friends and we hope to come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DMT1965
Reviews.Content: Read the other reviews and was not let down. The plus of staying on Lido is you get to see more of Venice and spend more time on the water due to being on the water taxi. The hotel was nicer than expected, with a great breakfast and wonderful location away from all the tourists. I would stay here again in heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Bargain Hotel but off the beaten track in April”
Reviews.Author: helensmith135
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this Hotel last minute for my 50th Birthday, unfortunately when we landed in Venice on Friday the buses were on a 24 hr strike and the boats were limited travel. We arrived at the Hotel which for a 2* was clean and tidy at 4.00pm and because we couldnt get to St Marks Square we had to stay in Lido. Unfortunately there was nothing, no bars, no restaurants, well we did manage to find one and had a pitza but not very good, the Hotel didnt realy have a bar so we felt as though an evening was wasted. Perhaps in the Summer the place livens up. However we had a fantastic day the next 2 days as we left the Hotel at 9.00am and got back at 11.30pm. The Hotel is realy basic and the beds are rock hard but everything ok, good value for money as a 2*

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: espengmbh
Reviews.Content: When you look at their webpage you think you have a distant view of St Marks square and the hotel is a white building,you have neither,these are just pictures from the area,our room No 30,was on the first floor,it had a small balconey,no view,and no chairs,we had to ask for two and carry them ourselves,the room was small but adequate,and clean,the bathroom while being small,( its a moduel like a boat,they buy them in complete,then install them) was very good,the staff were friendly,the breakfast room was good,the breakfast was OK,I would go back,just one small thing,my son tried to order a bottle of champagne as a wellcome for our arrival,he was told they do not accept visa over the phone.we asked if they could recommend pizza and fish restaurants,the pizza place on the sea front had a good view,the food was average,but the fish restaurant was one of the best meals i have had in my life,stunning.you have to pay for the beach.they also have a internet computer,slow,but just two euros fifty for half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ~ would stay again”
Reviews.Author: pear17
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable room. Good bathroom. Daily room service. Very good continental breakfast with lots of choice. 15 min walk to vaporetto stop or jump on one of the many buses with bus stop just along from the hotel or on the road a little way behind hotel. Would recommend buying the tourist transport ticket regardless of your length of stay. A few journeys on the buses on the Lido or the waterbuses to Venice and it has paid for itself. Very good links with the airport using the Alilaguna Boat service. Good restaurants on the Lido along Gran Viale Elisabetta.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay at a reasonable price. We would visit again.”
Reviews.Author: kingpinIreland
Reviews.Content: In July 2009, our family spent a short time at the Rivermare Hotel, Lido 30126 VENEZIA. We found the hotel to be well situated away from the hustle and bustle of Venice but within easy reach of the city by bus and water taxi. A beautiful quiet beach was within 3 minutes walk from the hotel which was much appreciated by my children. A tasty buffet breakfast was available each morning, our room was spacious and clean as was the en-suite bathroom. The staff were very helpful with regards to information on water taxi tickets, directions, etc. A most pleasant stay at a reasonable price. We would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Am I the only one with a different point of view?”
Reviews.Author: sandyandbetty
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews for this hotel I was sure it was goin to be one of the best on out 7 day tour of North east Italy. Well its fair to say it may be better value than those in Venice but compared to thehotels in the other 3 cities we visted this one was a real disappointment from the minute we enetred our room. Very small and basic I'm afaraid,clean well yes it was but it was a hot day and I felt this to be a bit clostophobic but we were "lucky" cos we had a small balcony--rusty railings and again pretty small. The bed had one of these old fasioned wardrobe surround and it had a shelf just at heade level above the pillows. My wife managed to give herslf a fair bump on it. Why not simply remove the blasted shelf as it wasn't serving any purpose anyway. Toilet was clean and functional. I'm afariad I got bitten quite badly in the room by mossys and I could hear them buzzing so after trying to hide under the sheet I eventually went out onto the balcony and I suspect I got even more bad bites. The people were certainly helpful enough but a mossy device would've been a good help to me. Would I go again? Sorry not even for the breakfast. Those blasted mossys made up my mind.

Reviews.Title: “we had a very good stay at Rivamare”
Reviews.Author: Mysuitcase5
Reviews.Content: This small very friendly family hotel is a very good choice if you want to visit Venice and enjoy the beach as well. We had two nice clean rooms with airconditioning(very important) The trip to St. Marco is short and there are many attractions to visit aroud the island.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with private beach”
Reviews.Author: Janhenrik
Reviews.Content: This summer we had the privilege of staying 14 days at Hotel Rivamare in the Venice Lido. We have been to many nice hotels in Europe and the US that we got good memories of, but this hotel is special, thanks to the Salmasi family and the friendly and caring way they run their hotel. Always there for you to give advice and assist you with whatever needs you may have. The rooms, all with air condition, are of a superior standard to a 2-star hotel. The bath rooms are spacious and very nice and clean. The breakfast buffet is well above average. The hotel is located 50 meters from the private beach where you can rent sunbeds, umbrellas etc. and make use of the nice beach restaurant which offers a various range of lunch and dinner alternatives to a reasonable price and with a relaxed atmosphare. In addition, the Lido offers good possibilites for all kinds of water sports, tennis, cycling etc. Rivamare hotel is only a few steps away from Palazzo del Cinema and 15 minutes away with boat (vaporetto) from Saint MarksÂ´ Square in Venice. If you are going to Venice, we recommend you to stay at the relaxing and quiet Hotel Rivamare and to take day trips to Vencie and to the the lagoon islands.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: pusle
Reviews.Content: July 2009 There are many reasons to choose this hotel. First of all itÂ´s only 2 minuttes on foot from the beach. And if you want to go sightseeing to Venice, it only takes 5 minuttes by bus to the harbour and then another 8 minuttes by boat. When you come to the hotel, you will see a beautiful front. The hotel is small but very nice, cosy and homely. The rooms are clean and and super. There is nothing to complain about. Breakfast is absolutely fine. There is everything you need. Coffee, milk, orange/pine apple juice, eggs, light bread, jam, cereals cheese etc. The staff is very kind and helpful to everyone. We do recommand this hotel, and someday we will return. :)

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and friendly welcome,immaculately clean and superb treatments.”
Reviews.Author: Cadez
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I was made to feel very welcome and the unexpected level of the treatments that are available completed my holiday. What better after a day sightseeing,shopping or sunbathing at the glorious beach (Just across the road!) than to have a wonderful massage or a lesson in meditation. I was assisted with advice on trips,operas and transport and always a cupm of tea when arriving back late after a very full day. Venice is an amazing,beautiful place and The Rivamare a haven of tranquility. Leela and Michela with the assistance of their parents run this hotel with the maximum efficiency and caring for their guests. I would certainly return when I am able to.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: msethu
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and booked this hotel. I should say the reviews in trip advisor are exact and we really enjoyed the stay here for 3 days in Rivamare hotel. Excellent bus connectivity from the Lido water bus station with a distance of 5-7 minutes to the hotel. As we had a 3 day pass which is valid on all water bus and local Lido buses, it was quite conveinient to go around places from this hotel. Good breakfast, short 5 mins bus ride to water bus station and catch a water bus to venice or murano is a perfect way to start the day. Our family room was quite spacious and clean. Good room cleaning service on all the days we spent here. All 3 days it was quite hot weather (with high humidity) in May (localities say this is an unusual hot weather for this month of the year) and as beach was right across the road we made it a point that we spend all evenings after 5pm in beach and did so. The re-sanding work has been completed now and the beach is in full use for the public. Great stay and excellent value for money !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, cozy typical family hotel, i will come back !”
Reviews.Author: torma
Reviews.Content: The island of lido di venezia is as wonderful as "Hotel Rivamare", walks along the beach and trips to Venice is in convinient distance. There is a homelike, relaxing atmosphere from the moment you arrive, to the moment you check out. The rooms are elegant and comfortable and in the warm summer there is air-condition. The breakfast is plenty and continental. Surely a hotel i would visit again. In fact i have allready booket my next vacation here in july.

Reviews.Title: “even if millionaires...”
Reviews.Author: TheCrista_s
Reviews.Content: It has been a wonderfull experience staying in Rivamare. Cozy and friendly atmosphere, and the stuff there is discreet, proffesional and very open and warm. Our daughter made us promise her that we are to stay in Rivamare every time we come to Venice, even if we are millionaires...

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at your grannies house”
Reviews.Author: *Jools*Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had read the reviews here on trip advisor and thought it sounded ok. We had two rooms a twin and a triple. It felt like you were staying at your grannies house. The furniture in the rooms is very dated and it had a strange smell. There is no lift and they put us on the third floor so we had to carry our cases and pushchair up a lot of stairs. We had a view of the local tennis club! There are push button lights for the stairs and corridors which didn't stay on long enough so we ended up in the dark quite a lot! It's a bit of a walk to the bus stop, then a bus trip to the waterbus stop but after that you get to take the waterbus into venice which is a lovely way to start each day.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, homely”
Reviews.Author: katger
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Hotel Rivamare at the Lido di Venezia, and this was the umpteenth time for us. This little Hotel is a great place, owned and handled by a very friendly and welcoming Family. They are happy to help in any question. The Hotel is basically at the beach, one just have to cross the road and there you are, you can jump into the beautiful clean and warm seewater. It is great, because mainly the locals use this part of the beach so one can really be part of the Italian "dolce vita". In just a few minute (perhaps 3 stops) one can get by bus to the main vaporetto/waterbus station and be soon in this fairytale city - Venice. So we got the culture - beauty - shopping (the Lido is cheeper and is really good, visit the mercato/market on Tuesdays) - and the beach. We recommend it strongly!

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: andy_goreing
Reviews.Content: Rivamare is a small hotel near the Beach. It is a short bus ride from the Vaporetti (water bus) stop and the main shops on Lido. We stayed for 6 nights in August. It's a family run place and everyone was helpful. We got great recommendations for eating locally. You can buy passes from reception for the buses and vaporetti. It saves (sometimes long) queues at the ticket counter. Breakfast was OK. Cold meats, cheeses, cereals, bread etc. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It seems good value for money - Venice is a very expensive city!!! There is no internet in the rooms but it is accessable from a PC near reception. It costs 2.50 Euros per half hour. Staying on Lido and visiting Venice is a very practical proposition. Getting to and from the main island is easy and getting to the other islands isn't difficult. The vaporetti are very frequent and run late.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rivamare”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaVenice
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hotel Rivamare in July 2008. This hotel is less than a block from the beach on Lido island, and is conveniently close to the bus stop (to get to the boat dock), and to stores and ATM machines. After sight-seeing in Venice each day our children loved taking the short boat ride back to Lido, to swim at the beach near the Rivamare in the afternoon. Our room facing the tennis courts was quiet and pleasant, with ample closet space and a nice tile bathroom with all amenities. The air conditioning worked well. The hotel is family-run by lovely people who helped make our stay in Venice wonderful. The buffet breakfast is great, in an attractive dining room. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this two-star hotel, which was reasonably priced and helped keep our trip affordable. When we return to Venice we will stay at the Rivamare again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict56
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice little hotel, managed by a nice family. I was there at the end of June with 2 girlfriends and the owners made us feel at home even if we were so far. It was our first time in Italy and Venice was our first stop. We just loved everything there, the warm welcome, the good advice, the room, the lovely breakfast hall, the beach just across the street. But what really made us happy has been not to be in downtown crowded, hot, crazy Venice. We just stayed three days and it wasn't enough, I wish we stayed longer. Suggestion: try the restaurant at the Tennis club just next door, quiet and great food. I liked the Melanzane Parmigiana, but also the Spaghetti alle Cozze were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: shesimon
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Venice â€“ Lido. I , my mother and my sister absolutely loved this place, a friendly and cosy environment, a fantastic base to explore Venice. Rivamare Staff was excellent making us so welcome, it was my birthday during our stay, a bottle of wine with wishes card was delivered to our room as a gift, what a surprise! It was just like being at home, couldnâ€™t have wished for more. The room was bright and comfortable with nice bamboo furniture; the same shells we found on the beach are used as key-rings for the rooms, a really beautiful and ecological idea! Superb breakfast, we enjoyed drinking our coffee on the sunny terrace among flowers and green plants. Then a healthy walk on the beach was the beginning of all our days in Venice. Hope to visit Venice and Lido again, weâ€™ll be back to the Rivamare!

Reviews.Title: “Wonbderful stay at the Lido”
Reviews.Author: Ingridnewyork
Reviews.Content: We were very glad we chose to stay in this charming and small hotel as we really had a great time at the Rivamare. The helpful staff and the hospitality were paramount to our Venetian visit. Every day a wonderfully smiling face came up with great sug-gestions for restaurants and the beach. The room was very nice and impeccably clean and we loved the wonderful buffet breakfast and the round the clock reception. The Lido surely was soothing and relaxing after a full day of walking in crowded Venice, and the beach just across the hotel street was exactly the relaxing and very quiet rest we needed, basking in the silence, the sand and the sea. We fully, fully reccomend it! Ingrid from New York City

Reviews.Title: “Fabuloso”
Reviews.Author: frisky148
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riva Mare, Venice Lido. Italy. Dates: May 9 to May 17, 2008 We were delighted with our stay at the two-star Riva Mare, located on the Venice Lido. It is a charming, intimate and family operated boutique hotel. Our room was comfortable and tastefully furnished with a modern ensuite bathroom. A sumptuous continental breakfast is served buffetstyle in a large, light and airy room, that opens to an outdoor terrace. We enjoyed breakfast inside and then took our delicious coffee outside to drink in the shade of the awning and evergreens. The Lido jetty is just a short bus or taxi ride away and allows for an expedient watertaxi transfer to all that Venice and the surrounding islands have to offer. The frontdesk sells transportation tickets with great maps and suggestions for the best trattoria to have lunch or dinner. After a good sightseeing day come home to the hotel Riva Mare and enjoy a refreshing campari on the terrace served from the lobby bar. For us, this stay was everything we could have wished for to capture a delightful and memorable Venetian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place near a great beach”
Reviews.Author: Jasperdog_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in Aug 07. The staff were friendly and spoke English. The room overlooked the tennis club and had 2 small balconies. It was clean, with parquet flooring, and sheets and towels changed often. The bathroom was small but modern. The beach is only about 50m away, and is sandy with a shallow slope into the water, with lifeguards present, so very safe. The only criticism of the beach is that it is closed from 7p.m. to 9a.m. every night, so romantic moonlit walks are out! Overall, a great holiday, with the hustle and bustle of Venice close but easily left behind for a quiet couple of hours on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful holidays with children”
Reviews.Author: Michael003
Reviews.Content: A small hotel,not far from beach.Very kindly people,all services in perfect quality.We were there with two children and hope,that we can come back here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_With_Dele
Reviews.Content: Good value... very friendly family run establishment. Visited with my wife and two friends of ours. Very handy location for the Lido beach... a number of good restaurants within walking distance. We will certainly return with the kids soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a small room”
Reviews.Author: Transmetropolitan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room for a week at the end of July. The room looked nice but it was a bit small without balcony and with a tiny bathroom. It had everything (hair dryer, air-conditioning) except mini-bar. We had a view of Tennis Club Venice from our window (which was really fun) and even the sea could be seen. The free beach is approx. 20 m away from the hotel. The bus that takes you to the vaporetto is 100 m. The family who runs the hotel was very friendly, the breakfast was fine. Room could have been cleaner. The Lido is a perfect place to stay with a child.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family run hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mappa1986
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay in a great location close to public transport and the beach, and because it was run by a family everyone was very friendly which made the place feel homely. Rooms were always cleaned and towels were always changed, and the air con was nice to come back to! would definetly recommend the hotel and the island of lido to others
